OrgName: Qualcomm Incorporated and its directly or indirectly 100% owned U.S. subsidiaries
activities: (1) employees and applicants of its subsidiaries for purposes of global HR administration and management; (2) contacts of actual and prospective corporate customers, business partners, and independent contractors and consultants in order to manage business relationships; (3) end users of various products and services for provision of services, support and development, and marketing activities; (4) individuals whose data Qualcomm processes on behalf of business customers as a data processor; (5) employees, contractors, consultants, customers or others gathered through a whistle-blower hotline and internal investigations in support of global code of conduct and compliance programs, and (6) employees contractors, customers or others in connection with pending or potential litigation or internal investigations.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Telecommunications Equipment - (TEL)General Science & Technology - (GST)Computer & Peripherals - (CPT)Computer Software - (CSF)
personaldata: on-line; off-line; manually processed; HR data
recoursemech: TRUSTe dispute resolution mechanism; EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland with respect to human resources data only.
